summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from July 2020 discussing a new potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein. An FBI agent in Phoenix was contacted by a detective about a victim who had been to Epstein's island as a teenager and wished to disclose information for the first time. The email is forwarded to the FBI's New York Crimes Against Children squad for handling.

persons.name: Andrew
persons.context: Addressed in an email from a Phoenix FBI agent seeking guidance on how to handle a detective's inquiry about a new Epstein victim disclosure.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referenced as the perpetrator whose victim, a teenager who visited his island, is now seeking to disclose information.

connections.description: The document references a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who visited his island as a teenager.

events.title: FBI Inquiry Regarding New Epstein Victim
events.description: An FBI agent in Phoenix receives a call from a detective about a victim of Jeffrey Epstein who had been to his island as a teenager and wishes to disclose information for the first time. The matter is referred to the FBI New York Crimes Against Children squad.

locations: Epstein's island (referenced as a location the victim visited)
keyFacts: In July 2020, a new potential victim of Jeffrey Epstein came forward for the first time.
The victim reportedly visited Epstein's island multiple times as a teenager.
The inquiry originated from a detective contacting an FBI agent in Phoenix.
The case was referred to the FBI New York Crimes Against Children squad (C20) for handling.
The document shows ongoing investigative activity related to Epstein victims years after his death.
